users.name: Ezra Landa
users.recipe: Kolace (Czech Pastries): Sweet pastries filled with poppy seeds, jam, or cheese, traditionally made by my grandmother every Purim.
users.story: My family immigrated from Czechoslovakia after WWII, preserving our unique minhagim including singing special tunes during Shabbat dinners passed down through generations.

users.name: Ilay Gibor
users.recipe: Shakshuka - Eggs poached in spicy tomato sauce with peppers and onions, taught to me by my grandfather every Friday morning.
users.story: My family moved from Morocco to Jerusalem, bringing vibrant Sephardic customs like the special chanting style of Kiddush on Shabbat.

users.name: Aaron Dardik
users.recipe: Classic Potato Kugel - A savory potato casserole recipe passed down from my great-grandmother, traditionally served during family gatherings and holidays.
users.story: Originally from Poland, my family settled in Los Angeles, keeping alive Ashkenazi traditions like gathering to bake challah together every Thursday night.
